text: Does anyone knows how to create a drag & drop email template for a Double Opt In Email with the module “Email Opt-in Link” ? Can’t find a module for that to drag to the template. Maybe I have to create a custom one for that …
Flex Column isn't available in an email
psst…. there are ways of mimicking that functionality though :neckbeard:
If you are using the new editor you can have repeatable fields.

yep, there’s also a way to do it in the old design manager using hubl, 

Though that method makes your code a lot more messy, which is kinda the last thing HTML emails need.
The best way I have found so far in the old editor is to make the sections custom modules. Then you can add them in the template.

agreed, that’s what I’ve been doing.

Been considering making a custom module using DM2 repeatable groups to basically be the entire email template. The theory being I’d have more control to make everything cross email client compatible.
<@U7W3F87T4> are you having the same issue with your templates?
Yep, but with just a few modules and also in bought templates from marketplace ... I fixed it by myself. I don't know atm if you can simply swap the HTML modules to be hubl modules.

So i've been trying to help out in the community forums and i keep getting this message:
```
Correct the highlighted errors and try again.

There was an error while attempting to post your message. Try again in a few minutes.````
problem is, i am just posting text and its starting to get annoying
Hey AJ, I'm going to look into this for you now
<@U2H3TT8F2> was this your post: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Content-Design-Questions/Move-large-image-on-image-slider-to-bottom-and-editing-slider/m-p/180072#M4932>
It was filtered as spam, so I whitelisted the post
Yep, I've had this happen on more of the posts i've done as well
can you simply whitelist me in general?
or any partner really
Anyone have any idea if we can specify certain email as transactional?
So it doesnt go into the promotional tabs in gmail?

We had an issue with bot spam earlier in the year, so our provider upped the stringency of filters. I'll look into this and see what can be done. Please feel free to DM me in this channel at any point if this happens again. I have open support ticket with our vendor, so will keep you posted.
You can, but it requires an add-on.  <https://www.HubSpot.com/products/email/transactional-email>
Is there a way to elevate an issue in our portal with the design manager? I've been trying to get a solve since yesterday and no luck
whats the issue? Just curious. I would say posting it here is a good way to get other HS employees to see it
We are not able to clone 2 different templates from our portal to 2 different client portals
We tested a few different ways to try to sort our the errors we are being given and nothing has worked
<@U22PWJ41G> might be able to assist or point in the right direction
do they both have the new beta design manager?
no, but even when we revert back to the old in ours and try that it won't copy
we even unselected the item the email states is having issues from the list of things to copy and we get the same email like it tried to transfer it anyway

Is there a way to re-layout a form that is embedded on a third party site to fit a format that would follow:
Left column - 5 fields
Right column - 3 fields

But both columns are equal height? I guess I could do it with some jquery and css, but is that overkill?
We tryed to transfer and it wouldnt because it was enabled in one and not in another.
Yes it’s possible, and yes you have to use css. You shouldn’t need to use any javascript.
<@U87NGNETZ> hooked me up with getting it enabled in both
were you getting an error that said the form was a model that could not be found?
css Display grid, display flex, and min-height are the tools you seek you do not need all of them, but they can make your life easier
if that is the issue I would love to get it applied ASAP! (and would owe you a beer)
I'd be happy to ungate any portals for the new Design Manager - I'd just need HubIDs
I actually just got an error that was blank (no text).. but it was the only thing I could think of. Once we got both portals enabled it was fixed.
<@U87NGNETZ> FTW :raised_hands:
<@U87NGNETZ> DM you those now
Yeah, I am trying to figure out how to configure the form, though, and make this a bit more scalable for other forms. Thank you for the input
<@U98RGFUQZ> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U98RGFUQZ/F9J5C8DM4/onetotwo.jpg|onetotwo.jpg>
Without having to configure this in HubSpot, the 6 first fields on the left and the bottom 3 on the right. I don’t want to have to hack it together with like a richtext field to break it up
<@U25C65C3S> didn't work...I think I'm going to give this one up for today and hope we get some technical help tomorrow
Did you opt-in to the new Design Manager when you retried <@U26D0TF8E>?
(in both portals that is)
yup
I have one more thing to try
Let us know if it works. I can also mention this to our team internally as well.
holy crap it finally worked
but it's by no means a solution
I had to completely remove the form module
Glad it worked! Not sure why you had to remove that module, but I sent a link to this chat to two folks internally so they can take a look.

Question for everyone...

Anyone have any great examples of LIVE pages/sites they have built using the new Design Manager? I'm looking to get a few up on <http://inspire.HubSpot.com|inspire.HubSpot.com>. We're also in the process of rebuilding the homepage for <http://designers.HubSpot.com|designers.HubSpot.com> and will likely feature one or two there.
DM me if you have any examples.
I'm testing it out on the second template but I don't think it's going to work if we have to delete modules every time we need to clone a template
nope...it won't work unless I delete the form module :disappointed:
Hmm. Is there anything you have applied to the module? I don't believe copying a template should require deleting the form.
in the templates themselves I don't believe there's anything other than a class
cc: <@U22PWJ41G> <@U7UBMQMDK>
thanks for your help <@U22PU4G4A> <@U25C65C3S> <@U87NGNETZ>
